Class SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation

java.lang.Object
org.dyn4j.collision.AbstractCollisionBody<org.dyn4j.dynamics.BodyFixture>
org.dyn4j.dynamics.AbstractPhysicsBody
org.dyn4j.dynamics.Body
org.ironmaple.simulation.drivesims.AbstractDriveTrainSimulation
org.ironmaple.simulation.drivesims.SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Subsystem, org.dyn4j.collision.CollisionBody<org.dyn4j.dynamics.BodyFixture>, org.dyn4j.DataContainer, org.dyn4j.dynamics.PhysicsBody, org.dyn4j.geometry.Rotatable, org.dyn4j.geometry.Shiftable, org.dyn4j.geometry.Transformable, org.dyn4j.geometry.Translatable, org.dyn4j.Ownable
public class SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation extends AbstractDriveTrainSimulation implements Subsystem

Simulates a Simplified Holonomic Drivetrain.

This class simulates a simplified holonomic drivetrain with collision space, allowing the drivetrain to drive on the field.

It is suitable for simulating AI cycle bots or opponent defense bots.

However, this drivetrain simulation is simplified and not entirely realisticâ€”while it accelerates smoothly, the kinematics are not fully accurate.

For a more realistic simulation of your robot's drivetrain, use SwerveDriveSimulation instead.

  • Constructor Details

    • SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation

      public SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation(AbstractDriveTrainSimulation.DriveTrainSimulationProfile profile, Pose2d initialPoseOnField)

      Creates a Simplified Holonomic Drivetrain Simulation.

      Parameters:
      profile - the profile containing all the configuration settings for the drivetrain, see AbstractDriveTrainSimulation.DriveTrainSimulationProfile
      initialPoseOnField - the initial pose of the drivetrain in the simulation world

  • Method Details

    • runChassisSpeeds

      public void runChassisSpeeds(ChassisSpeeds speeds, boolean fieldRelative)

      Runs Chassis Speeds on This Simulated Chassis.

      This method sets the DESIRED robot-relative chassis speeds on the simulated drivetrain.

      Propelling forces will be applied to the chassis to help it accelerate smoothly to the desired speeds.

      This method is different from AbstractDriveTrainSimulation.setRobotSpeeds(ChassisSpeeds), which jumps to the speed Instantaneously.

      Parameters:
      speeds - the desired robot-relative speeds, represented as ChassisSpeeds

    • simulationSubTick

      public void simulationSubTick()

      Update this chassis simulation.
